Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) are promising sustainable energy systems due to their high energy conversion efficiency and low pollutant emission rate.
Titulo: Tailoring the Ratio of A-Site Cations in Pr1-xNdxBaCo1.6Fe0.4O5+δ to Promote the Higher Oxygen Reduction Reaction Activity for Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: However, the high operating temperature induces poor durability of the systems.
Titulo: Tailoring the Ratio of A-Site Cations in Pr1-xNdxBaCo1.6Fe0.4O5+δ to Promote the Higher Oxygen Reduction Reaction Activity for Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Therefore, it is crucial to improve the oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) activity of the cathode material to lower the operating temperature.
Titulo: Tailoring the Ratio of A-Site Cations in Pr1-xNdxBaCo1.6Fe0.4O5+δ to Promote the Higher Oxygen Reduction Reaction Activity for Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Recently, a double-layered perovskite material (AA'B2O5+delta), especially PrBaCo1.6Fe0.4O5+delta (PBCF), has received significant attention due to its high ORR activity.
Titulo: Tailoring the Ratio of A-Site Cations in Pr1-xNdxBaCo1.6Fe0.4O5+δ to Promote the Higher Oxygen Reduction Reaction Activity for Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Herein, we report an A-site-tailored PBCF cathode material to enhance the ORR activity by employing a dopant that can increase oxygen vacancies in the structure.
Titulo: Tailoring the Ratio of A-Site Cations in Pr1-xNdxBaCo1.6Fe0.4O5+δ to Promote the Higher Oxygen Reduction Reaction Activity for Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Since the oxygen vacancy is known as the charge carrier for the oxygen ion in oxide materials, increasing the oxygen vacancy concentration can improve the electrochemical performances of the cathode material at a lower operating temperature range (under 600 degrees C).
Titulo: Tailoring the Ratio of A-Site Cations in Pr1-xNdxBaCo1.6Fe0.4O5+δ to Promote the Higher Oxygen Reduction Reaction Activity for Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Nd was employed as a dopant at the A-site due to its similarity in size to Pr and the lower valance state, which can increase the oxygen vacancy concentration in the structure.
Titulo: Tailoring the Ratio of A-Site Cations in Pr1-xNdxBaCo1.6Fe0.4O5+δ to Promote the Higher Oxygen Reduction Reaction Activity for Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The cathode material with 20% Nd in the A-site of PBCF showed the highest I-V-P performance and lowest activation energy for the oxygen reduction reaction.
Titulo: Tailoring the Ratio of A-Site Cations in Pr1-xNdxBaCo1.6Fe0.4O5+δ to Promote the Higher Oxygen Reduction Reaction Activity for Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: As a result, our designed material showed a high peak power density of 1.34 W/cm(2) at 600 degrees C, which is 109% higher than that of PBCF.
Titulo: Tailoring the Ratio of A-Site Cations in Pr1-xNdxBaCo1.6Fe0.4O5+δ to Promote the Higher Oxygen Reduction Reaction Activity for Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
